title: Edit an asset model record
content:
You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

  1. From the main menu, select Build >Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Asset Models.

  3. There're two ways to view the SACM asset model records: tree view and table view.

    In the tree view:

    1. Select the asset model.

    2. Click , then Edit to display the selected record.

    In the table view:

    1. Select the asset model.

    2. Click the record identifier in the Id column to display the selected record.

  4. By default, the asset model record is displayed with the General tab selected. Click the tab you want to edit or view:

    Tab Description
    General Displays details of the selected record. For more information, see the General tab section.
    Workflow

    Displays the workflow for the model. To change the status to inactive, you must have the appropriate rights. For more information about model status, see How to retire an asset model record.
    Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the current record. For more information about discussions, see Discussions.
    History Displays changes to the selected record. For more information about history, see History.
    User options

    User options are specific user defined attributes for an asset model. For more information, see the User options tab section.

    Available when: the Model type is Enterprise Asset and Category is unselected.
    Default values

    Set default values for the details of the asset model. For more information, see the Default values tab section.

    Available when: the Model type is Enterprise Asset and Category is unselected.
    Rules

    Defined business rules for an asset model. For more information, see the Rules tab section.

    Available when: the Model type is Enterprise Asset and Category is unselected.

  5. Save your changes.

General tab

Asset Model details

Field Description
Model type

The asset type to which this model may be applied . For example, Device.

According to the chosen model type, Service Management displays an additional field for the subtype of the model. Select a value from the drop-down list.
Display label External (common) name of the asset model.
UNSPSC code Relevant UNSPSC code. 
SKU number The stock-keeping unit of the asset model.
Brand Brand of the asset model.
Parent model Parent model of the selected asset model record.
Owner The owner of the model.
Cost type Type of cost. For example, hardware maintenance or software.
Category

If you select this option, the asset model is a category. This enables you to categorize a group of models in one theme.

  • If selected, this record doesn't appear as a selectable asset model for assets.
  • If not selected, this record does appear as a selectable asset model for assets.
Description Detailed description of the asset model.
Review status The review status of the model, including pending, in progress, done, and rejected.
Reason The reason of creating the new asset model.
Picture Click Upload image to upload a picture of the asset model.
Total amount

Cost of the model.

Available when: the Category option isn't selected.
Currency

Currency for the Total amount.

Available when: the Category option isn't selected.
Depreciation scheme Scheme on how the asset model is depreciated , such as linear, geometric, or sum of digits.
Depreciation duration The duration of depreciation (in months) for the selected asset model. The value that you specify must be a multiple of 12, such as 24, 36, or 48.
Depreciation rate

The rate that the asset model is to be depreciated .

Available when: the Geometric depreciation scheme is selected.

Model type specific fields

Model type: Device

Device subtype

Subtype of the device.

Model type: License

License metric

License metric of the license model. For example, by CPU.

Note: This field works only for the original SAM application. If you have enabled the new SAM capability, we recommend that you remove this field from the Forms tab page. This is because the new SAM capability has its own License metric field in the Software coverage section.
Count per pack The number of licenses for a purchase pack.

For this field, check the publisher's SKU. In most cases, the value is 1.
Pack price Price for a pack.

This field is required if you want to view the license cost information in SAM, especially for the estimated cost for purchasing required licenses.

Model type: Infrastructure & Peripheral

Infrastructure & Peripheral subtype

Subtype of the infrastructure & peripheral.

Model type: Service

Service subtype

Subtype of the service.

Model type: Enterprise Asset

Subtype Subtype of the enterprise asset.
Process type

Type of the enterprise asset process, including Full Ownership, Consumable, and Stationary.​​
Batch

Select this option if you want assets created from this model to be managed collectively instead of individually.

Available when: The process type is Consumable.
Unit of measure

The unit of measure of the individual assets in the asset model. 

Available when: The Batch option is selected.

Software coverage

The Software coverage section is only applicable to the license asset model after enabling the new SAM capability.

Field Description
License metric

License metric used for compliance calculation. For example, by CPU.

To choose the correct license metric for the license model, we recommend that you manage licenses by publisher.
Product version

The version of the product. This field helps to build license pool information. SAM will learn about the product versions covered by a specific license. 

To add multiple products, click Add. For each product, you can only set one version. For cost-effectiveness, we recommend that you select the highest product version available for your license. 

To delete a product, click Remove.

SAM maintains the license compatibility matrix that describes how a license can transfer among different versions and editions. For more information, see License metrics.

Sustainability

The Sustainability section is only applicable to the Device, Infrastructure & Peripheral, or Enterprise Asset asset models after enabling the carbon footprint calculation feature.

Field  Description 
Location  The place where the instance of your asset model is used
Product lifetime (Year)  Expected lifetime of your asset model in years 
Energy demand (TEC, kWh/year)  Expected energy consumption for your asset model over a one-year period 
Lifetime usage emissions 

Scope 2 carbon emissions generated at use phase of your asset model

Basically, Lifetime usage emissions = Energy demand (TEC, kWh/year) * Product lifetime (Year) * Carbon intensity of electricity (kgCO2e/kWh), where the value of  Carbon intensity of electricity (kgCO2e/kWh) is defined in Location.  If there are valid values in the three fields, the value of Lifetime usage emissions  will be automatically calculated. 
Embodied emissions  Scope 3 carbon emissions generated at manufacturing, transport and end-of-life phase of your asset model
Emission recurring period  Recurring period of carbon emissions: Weekly, Monthly, or Yearly 
Recurring usage emissions  Recurring lifetime usage emissions based on emission recurring period. For example: If Emission recurring period = monthly, then Recurring usage emissions = Lifetime usage emissions / Product lifetime (Year) / 12 
Total emissions  Total carbon emissions of your asset model, including both Lifetime usage emissions (Scope 2) and Embodied emissions (Scope 3)
Unit 

Unit of carbon emissions

Note that only kgCO2e is supported in this release. 

Sub Asset Models

This section displays asset models which are subsidiary to the current asset model record. For example, an asset model called Computers might have Computer servers, Point of Sale POS terminals, and Notebook computers displayed as sub asset models.

Attachments

Click Add attachment if you want to attach a file to the record.

 
  • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.
  • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.
  • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.

User options tab

The user options tab allows you to add custom fields to the asset model.

You can define the user options as individual fields, or you can classify the fields into different groups and sections if you need to manage multiple user options with different types.

After you add a group (Level 1) under a section (Level 1), you can further add a sub-section (Level 2) to the group (Level 1) and then add a sub-group (Level 2) to the sub-section (Level 2). You can define up to 3 levels of depth for sections and groups if required.
Note: When you delete a section or a group, all sub-groups and sub-sections and fields under this section or group will also be deleted.

Add a section

  1. Click New section to add a section.

  2. (Optional) Select a group where you want the section to appear. If you don't select any group, the section will be displayed as an individual section.

  3. The properties for each section are shown in the right pane.
    Property Description
    Display name

    The display name of the section in the Service Management user interface.
    Field size The size of the field in the Service Management user interface. You can select Medium or Large as needed.
    Required Users must give this property a value when editing it from the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.
    Help text

    Provide help text to give some details or hints of this user option.

    The maximum length of Help text is 200 characters.

  4. Click the Move Up and Move down buttons on the toolbar to determine the order in which the whole section (including all sub-groups and sub-sections and fields under this section) should be displayed.

Add a group

  1. Click New group to add a section.

  2. Select a section where you want the group to appear. 

  3. The properties for each group are shown in the right pane.
    Property Description
    Display name

    The display name of the group in the Service Management user interface.
    Field size The size of the field in the Service Management user interface. You can select Medium or Large as needed.
    Help text

    Provide help text to give some details or hints of this user option. 

    The maximum length of Help text is 200 characters.

  4. Click the Move Up and Move down buttons on the toolbar to determine the order in which the whole group (including all sub-sections and sub-groups and fields under this group) should be displayed.

Add a field

  1. Click New field to add a field.

  2. (Optional) Select a group where you want the field to appear. If you don't select any group, the field will be displayed as an individual field.

  3. The properties for each field are shown in the right pane.

    Property Description
    Name

    The name of the user option. The name:

    • Must start with an upper case letter.
    • May contain alphanumeric characters only (A-Z, a-z, 0-9 ).
    • May not contain spaces.
    • Must end with _c. This suffix is added automatically. You don't need to enter it manually.
    Display name

    The display name of the field in the Service Management user interface.
    Field type

    The field type:

    String. A textual value.

    Boolean. A true or false value.

    Integer. A numeric value without a decimal point.  Double. A numeric value with a decimal point.

    List. A list of values. You are allowed to select one value from the list. Select a predefined list, or click  Add to define a new list. Edit the list's items if desired.

    Creating and saving a new list will display the List order field. Select Alphabetical to sort the list alphabetically, or Ordinal to sort the list by the user-defined order. For more information, see Create or edit a list in the User Options tab.

    For editable lists, you can edit the list items here. For more information, see Lists.

    Multi-Select List. A list of values, which is similar to the List above. The only difference is that you are allowed to select multiple values from the list.

    Date. A date value.

    Rich text. A value in rich text format.

    DateTime. A value with date and time. Entity Link: A value that's an entity link. When selected, displays the Entity type field, allowing you to select an entity type from the list. For more information, see Use entity links in user options.

    Encrypted String. A texture value that needs encryption. It's normally used for confidential data such as passwords. Use this type when you want to encrypt the value of the user option in the Service Management database.

    Notes:

    • The maximum length of String, Integer, and Rich text fields are the same as the maximum length of SMALL_TEXT, INTEGER, and RICH_TEXT logical types defined in Logical type details.
    • For the system to encrypt the user option in Encrypted String type, the tenant admin must set the passcode to initialize the key chain for encryption in Application Settings.

    • If you define a default value for the user option in the Encrypted String type, the default value in the template record (such as an offering or a change model) isn't encrypted; only the data entered by the end users needs encryption.

    • As Encrypted String uses a tenant key chain for encryption and the tenant key chain is different from encryption domains, you can not decrypt the encrypted data in the Encrypted String fields. Currently, the system only decrypts the value of this type when Service Management communicates with DND for cloud service deployment.
    Field size The size of the field in the Service Management user interface. You can select Medium or Large as needed.
    Required Users must give this property a value when editing it from the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.
    Help text

    Provide help text to give some details or hints of this user option. 

    The maximum length of Help text is 200 characters.
  4. Repeat the previous step for each new field.
  5. Click Move Up or Move down on the toolbar to determine the display order of the new fields.

Default values tab

Click the Default values tab and complete the information relevant for the model.

Rules tab

Click the Rules tab to add business rules to the model.

For each of the process events, you can add rules to run before or after the general record business rules. For more information, see here.
